characters: CAMERA MOVES INTO THE DARK PUPIL-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the foreground, OFELIA - 11 years old, skin white as snow, ruby lips and ebony hair - is sprawled on the groun A thick ribbon of blood runs from her nose. But - the blood is flowing backward into her nostril. Dro by drop, the blood leaps up and disappears. Ofelia's pupils dilate-

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Long ago in the Underground Realm...

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: ...where there are no lies or pain, there lived a Princess who dreamt of the human world.  The sound of muffled wind.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: She dreamt of blue skies, the soft breeze and sunshine... A dark CASTLE takes shape. Here, a tower... there, a turret... and lighted windows. Finally, the damp, mildewed walls of a water well come in focus.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: One day, eluding her keepers, the Princess escaped. A woman's silhouette crosses CAMERA-

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Once outside, the brightness blinded her and erased her memory... A circular staircase leads up... toward daylight, where t image...

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: She forgot who she was and where she came from. Her body suffered cold, sickness and pain. Eventually, she died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS past scenes of destruction: bombed-out buildings... cathedrals in ruins.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Her father, the King, always knew that the Princess would return, perhaps in another body, in another place, at another time. On half-demolished walls, Falangist posters declare Franc triumph. Among the ruins, smaller, poignant traces of wa shoes, broken eye-glasses...

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: And he would wait for her, until he drew his last breath, until the world stopped turning... Through the ruined buildings, a SMALL CARAVAN OF BLACK BENTLEY CARS comes into view. The shiny chrome fenders pass directly by CAMERA; they be all the Fascist insignias and flags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out the window: OFELIA. She's dressed in plain, slightly frayed clothing. Not ver dainty. On her lap is a book of fairy tales. CAMERA studies one of the watercolors that adorn the page an illustration of a little girl dancing with several fairies flying around her. At her side, a small pile of similar books in a book stra

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: I don't understand why you had to bring so many books, Ofelia. Ofelia turns her gaze toward the opposite seat, where her mother, CARMEN, 28, is napping, her enormous stomach evidence of advanced pregnancy. She, too, has black hair.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: We're going to the country... the outdoors... plenty of fresh air. She takes the book away from Ofelia.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Fairy tales? You're too old to be filling your head with such nonsense.  She pauses, feeling nausea.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Ask them to stop the car- please- Ofelia knocks on the partition window of the sedan. The Driver stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan of cars stops. Carmen hurriedly climbs down a moves to the front of the main car. Gasping for air, she battles the nausea. Ofelia timidly approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Ofelia, wait up. She grabs her pregnant abdomen.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Your brother's not well. Ofelia nods and moves away. SERRANO, a military man, clim out of the car behind them and approaches Carmen solicito

dialogues.speaker: SERRANO
dialogues.text: Madam, are you feeling ill?

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Water- just a bit of water-

dialogues.speaker: SERRANO
dialogues.text: (to one of his men) Water, bring water for the Captain's wife. Ofelia walks alongside the road, moving into the woods an further away from the caravan of cars. CAMERA surveys the heavy forest: a tangled tapestry of mo and fog. The trees, swayed by the wind, murmur softly around Ofel She stumbles upon a strange stone by the side of the road Roughly the size of a fist- carved on it, the outline of human EYE. Fascinated, the young girl picks it up. She looks around and finds -amidst the shrubs- an ancient stone monolith incised with Celtic lettering. It's crowned with the grotesque face of a satyr- mouth op wide. A piece of the brutish face is missing: an eye. Ofelia fits the piece of engraved stone in the missing ar A perfect fit. From inside the statue a clicking noise emerges. The wind picks up and- -out of the satyr's open mouth, a STICK INSECT lazily cra out. Ofelia smiles. The insect climbs atop the stone head and studies the girl for a moment. Then-

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Ofelia?? The sound of Carmen's voice startles the creature, which off. Ofelia runs to her mother's side. OFELIA. (enthusiastic) A fairy- I saw a fairy!!

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Oh- look at your shoes!! They're covered in mud! They head back to the caravan.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: When we get to the mill I want you to greet Captain Vidal. That man- has been very good to us, darling. You have no idea- So, I want you to call him "Father." Do you hear me? "Father..." It's just a word, Ofelia. The Stick Insect lands in a nearby tree and observes inqu as Mother and daughter climb into the main car and head o A beat later, the Stick Insect flies after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP: a gold pocket watch, on a heavy chain. The glas dial is cracked... A gloved THUMB snaps the cover shut. A VOICE - CAPTAIN VI - mutters in irritation.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes late. ANGLE WIDENS to describe a dilapidated WATER MILL. The site consists of a pair of dark stone buildings with corrugated roofs, connected to the mill by a small stone bridge. A large water wheel hangs over the dry riverbed. The wooden beams and columns bear sculpted Celtic motifs here and there, small, odd, carved creatures. The walls have been reinforced with hundreds of sand-bags and wooden pontoons, as if preparing for an attack. CAPTAIN VIDAL and a small group of SERVANTS and SOLDIERS wait patiently outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain!! They're here- The caravan of Bentleys stops in front of the building. V and his group moves in. Servants and Soldiers unload lugg withy military efficiency. In charge is MERCEDES, a young but strict country woman. Vidal greets Carmen.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Carmen- Welcome- With a pleasant smile, he touches her pregnant belly and then points at a wooden wheelchair pushed to Carmen's sid by a small, nervous man SGT. GARCES. By his side stands DOCTOR FERREIRO, a pleasant, scholarly man in his mid forties.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: I- I don't need it- I can walk by myself.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Doctor Ferreiro prefers that you don't exert yourself.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: N-no... Vidal leans towards her and whispers -ever so softly- in ear:

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Then do it for me... She obeys. As she sits, Ofelia exits the automobile, hold her books close to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Ofelia. Greet the Captain. She is wheeled away. An awkward silence passes between th young girl and the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Ofelia- The girl extends her hand. He grabs it, firm but cold. I her left hand.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: It's the other hand, Ofelia. He turns to the servants.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Mercedes, take my wife's luggage to her room-

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Mercedes glances back to find Ofelia curiously gazing at- -a pile of sandbags. Perched on top- -the big Stick Insect. It fans out its multiple wings. Twice. Ofelia runs over a tries to catch it. But the Stick Insect takes off and escapes. The girl drop books and goes after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia follows the Stick Insect to the edge of a small ri She follows it with her eyes and sees, about 100 meters away, surrounded by trees, the ruins of a garden LABYRINT The CAMERA glides up for a better view. The labyrinth is circular, its paths overgrown and partially blocked. Ofelia enters the labyrinth through an archway. She ventu down one of its pathways and stops-

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: It's a labyrinth- Ofelia turns- the young woman stands by her side. Ofelia books in hand.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Just a pile of old stones. They've always been there, even before the mill. Better you don't go near it- You could get lost. A ray of sunlight breaks through the grey clouds and illuminates the old ruins. Mercedes hands her the books. OFELIA. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Have you read them all? GarcГ©s shouts from the mill:

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Mercedes! (Mercedes reacts) The CaptainвЂ™s calling you. Mercedes makes a small gesture of goodbye to Ofelia.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Your father needs me. She turns and walks away- OFELIA. He's not my father. Mercedes doesn't understand. The girl runs up to her. OFELIA. The Captain- he's not my father. My father was a tailor. He died in the war. The CaptainвЂ™s not my father! Mercedes can't help but smile at the girl's sudden vehemence.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Well, you've made that clear enough. They walk away together. OFELIA. Did you see my mother? (Mercedes nods) She's pretty isn't she? (Mercedes nods) You saw her belly? She's sick with child. As they go into the house, the Stick Insect - perched ato the labyrinth's archway - monitors their every move.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: The guerillas are sticking to the woods because it's hard to track them down up there. Vidal is standing at an enormous dining table. Serrano, GarcГ©s and a few lower-ranking officials surround him.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Those pricks know the terrain better than any of us. We need to force them down - Vidal sticks pins into one of the larger maps.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: -let's block their access to medicine and supplies. Mercedes enters bearing a tray of olives, cold cuts and a bottle of Orujo liquor.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: We'll set up three command posts. Here, here and here. Mercedes glances briefly at the maps, concealing avid  interest. Suddenly, Vidal grabs Mercedes by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Have Dr. Ferreiro come see me.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir... Turning his attention back to his maps, Vidal takes two olives and pops them into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: (chewing) Those bastards are going to starve... you'll see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor stirs some drops of medicine into a glass of water. Carmen lies back in a monumental carved bed. On he lap there are several playing cards.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Just four drops at bedtime and you'll sleep all night long. He gives her the water and the medicine vial. Carmen drin weakly. Ofelia stands by her side.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Don't hesitate to call if you need anything, Madame. You- or your little nurse. He grins at Ofelia, then exits the room. Carmen gives Ofe the medicine vial.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Go. Close the door so I can sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hallway, the doctor finds Mercedes waiting for him They proceed in silence down the hallway and look down in the foyer: empty.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: You must come up the mountain and see him- the leg wound- its getting worse... The doctor nods timidly and gives Mercedes a small PACKAG wrapped in dark paper and neatly tied in string.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: This is all I could get. I'm sorry. Mercedes sighs, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: He's downstairs- don't keep him waiting. The doctor moves downstairs. Mercedes glances toward the Upper Bedroom and- -discovers Ofelia, watching her attentively- how long has she been there? The girl closes the door quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia takes off her shoes and climbs into her mother's b As she cuddles close to her mother-

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Jesus- Your feet- they're frozen. She caresses Ofelia's head. The wind picks up and the hou timbers moan and creak.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Are you scared?  OFELIA. A little bit. OFELIA. What's that noise?

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Nothing, just the wind. Nights here are different from city nights. There, you hear cars, trains. Here the houses are old and creaky. The house utters a series of deep, rumbling noises.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Almost like they're speaking. Tomorrow, I'm going to give you something special. OFELIA. A book?

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: No, something much better. A beat of silence and then- OFELIA. Why did you have to get married?

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: We were alone too long. OFELIA. You weren't alone. You were never alone.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: When you're older you'll understand. It hasn't been easy for me. She winces in pain-

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Your brother's- he's acting up. Tell him one of your stories so he'll calm down. Ofelia gently leans on her mother's stomach and taps it one finger, as if it were a telegraph key.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: My brother, my brother... Carmen closes her eyes and listens to her daughter's voic OFELIA. ... a long, long time ago in a grey, sad country...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE STOMACH
dialogues.text: Floating in a limbo of amniotic fluid, the BABY opens his eyes and listens. OFELIA. There was a magic rose that made whoever plucked it immortal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against a scarlet sky: a BLUE ROSE. Its thorny stem clutc the dagger-like crest of a black granite mountain. The thorns grow around the granite like suffocating serpents.

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But no one would dare go near it because its thorns were full of mortal poison. The Stick Insect lands on one of the thorns and then flie into the night sky-

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So amongst the men tales of pain and death were told in hushed voices. But there was no talk of eternal life... because men fear pain more than they  want immortality. -up, up and then through-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -the WINDOW of the Upper Bedroom. Through the glass, the Stick Insect observes how Ofelia h mother. OFELIA. So every day the rose wilted unable to bequeath his gift to anyone-- The Stick Insect clicks its jaws in excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The improvised office is in one of the lower rooms, where the gigantic mill wheel and the wooden gears lie in a hea

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Alone and forgotten at the top of that mountain. Forgotten until the end of time... Small steel gears shine like metallic stars on a small swatch of black velvet. Tweezers pick them up and- -put them into place within the workings of a watch. Using a jeweler's magnifying glass, Vidal oils and closes his pocket watch while he listens to cuplГ© (traditional Spanish music) on a phonograph. The doctor comes to the door. Vidal motions for him to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in- How is she?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Very weak. Vidal closes the watch.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: She'll rest as much as she needs to. I'll sleep down here. And my son?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Your-? Serrano and GarcГ©s enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Excuse us, Captain... Vidal motions for them to be silent. Then he looks at the Doctor again.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: My son. How is he?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: For the moment, there's no reason to be alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Good. ThatвЂ™s good.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Captain. Your wife- she shouldn't have traveled this late in the pregnancy.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Is that your opinion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My professional opinion, yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Well, a boy should be born wherever his father is. And that's that. He heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Captain... Vidal stops and looks at him fixedly.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: One more thing, sir. What makes you so sure it's a boy?

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me. He exits the mill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mill and the tents are silhouettes in the night. Soldiers patrol the gravel paths. Vidal, GarcГ©s and Serrano walk towards the outer Water Wheel. There, a small group of soldiers surrounds an OLD and his young SON.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: At 8 o'clock, we detected activity in the southeastern sector. Gunfire. Sergeant Bayona captured a suspect. The other prisoner is his son, who's here from town.

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: Captain, my father is an honorable man.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: I'll decide that. Take your hat off when you talk to me. The Son quietly obeys. BAYONA hands the Captain a small gauge rifle and a leather pouch.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: We found this weapon. It's been fired.

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: He was hunting rabbits -

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Shut up, damn it. Vidal takes opens the leather pouch and finds a farmer's almanac. He reads an inscription printed on the back page

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: "...No God, nor Government, nor Master?"

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Red propaganda, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: It's not propaganda, Sir. Vidal, impatiently motions for him to be silent.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: "It's an old almanac; we're farmers, sir."

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: I was in the forest hunting rabbits for my daughters. They're sick.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Rabbits, uh? In the pouch, Vidal finds a half-empty bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, if my father says so- he was hunting rabbits. Vidal hands GarcГ©s the pouch and moves towards the boy, bottle in hand. BAM!! Without warning he flattens the boy's nose with the bottle bottom. The Father screams, horrified, but without the guts to intervene. Vidal lifts the Son up, bashes his nose again and again, leveling bone and cartilage.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: No!! No!! You killed him!! You son ofa bitch! Vidal drops the boy, who falls to the ground spitting blo He turns to the Father and shoots him twice in cold blood then turns to the Son and shoots him once, in the head. Then all is silence. The distant whistle of a train can b heard. Vidal heads back towards GarcГ©s and calmly search the pouch: Inside he finds two scrawny rabbits.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Learn to frisk these motherfuckers before you come bothering me.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Yes, my Captain. He moves away. And he takes the rabbits with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes wide, Ofelia hears a dry rattle, followed by a soft ululation at the window, which is half open. The curtains billow.  The mill groans. Ofelia is restless. Then- a dry clicking noise. OFELIA. Mama, wake up- Carmen doesn't move. A scuttling noise reaches her ears a something small and quick skitters over the floor. OFELIA. Mother- please! There's something in the room- Impossible. Ofelia gets up and carefully puts on her shoe Something shifts in the ceiling beams. Ofelia looks up, searching. Nothing. Suddenly, something the size of a human hand scurries past her feet and hides under the bed. Then, pulling at the goose down comforter, the Stick Inse up into the bed. Ofelia leans over it, shocked. OFELIA. H-hello- Did you follow me here?? The Stick Insect clicks its mandibles. OFELIA. Are you a fairy?? The Stick Insect regards her with curiosity. OFELIA. Look- This is a fairy- She picks up one of her books and opens it to an illustration: a beautiful fairy. The Stick Insect scrutinizes the illustration and sits up opens and closes its wings, transforming into a GREEN FAI a tiny human form with striped wings. The Green Fairy flies to the foot of the bed, pointing to  the window. OFELIA. You want me to go with you? Outside? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Green Fairy flies swiftly, but Ofelia follows close behind. Suddenly it stops! TheyвЂ™re at the ruins of the labyrinth, which is bathed moonlight. Trees and roots crowd the broken niches, as if fused with the stone. Some of the pathways are blocked by gnarled tr that have grown through the rock.

dialogues.speaker: LABYRINTH
dialogues.text: Ofelia runs through the narrow, spooky pathways, but she lost sight of the Green Fairy. Ofelia stops and looks around until she spots it, waiting for her at-

dialogues.speaker: ROTUNDA AT CENTER OF LABYRINTH
dialogues.text: The Green Fairy alights on an ancient monolith at the edg empty stone pool. It's decorated in Celtic lettering, jus like the one in the forest. Another monolith stands at its center. Ofelia nears the edge of the pool. OFELIA. Hello?! The pool returns her cry, again and again. The tree trun creak- and a cloud covers the moon. OFELIA. Echo! Echo! Then, she hears the sound of something big clattering abo on hooves, like a horse or a bull.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: It's you- It's you- You've returned!! The VOICE is cold and full of sibilance. The cloud moves aside... On its hind quarters in the shadows is the twisted and sinister figure of a FAUN. He's covered in roots and moss Ofelia backs away- speechless.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: No- no- don't be afraid- I beg you!! Look!! He opens a small wicker basket and from it emerge two mor FAIRIES: one BLUE, one RED. Ofelia smiles. OFELIA. My name is Ofelia. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: Me? I've had so many names. Old names that only the wind and the trees can pronounce. The Green Fairy flies toward its colorful companions.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: Tam the mountain, the forest and the earth. I am... a faun. As he bows to her, moonlight dapples his body. His coarse hooves and the strange angle of his legs make his courtly  manner clumsy yet oddly gracious.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: Your Highness- OFELIA. No, I'm -

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You are Princess Moanna, daughter of the King of the Underworld. OFELIA. No- My father was a tailor.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You are not born of man. It was the moon that bore you. Look on your left shoulder and you will find a mark that proves it. Ofelia instinctively touches her shoulder, with a strange expression on her face.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: Your real father had us open portals all over the world to allow your return. This is the last of them. He opens his arm and gestures at the well around them.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: But we have to make sure that your essence is intact, that you have not become a mortal. To insure your return, you have three tasks to fulfill - before the moon is full. The Faun steps back a few paces. He deposits a large leat bound book on the ground, as well as a leather bag.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: This is the Book of Crossroads. Open it  when you're alone and it will show you your future - show you what must be done. Then he and the Fairies fade back into the shadows. Ofelia goes to the book and opens it. No matter how many pages she turns- -they are all blank. OFELIA. There's nothing here- But she is alone. Absolutely alone in the well. MUSIC sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal, shirtless, shaves with a switchblade while listeni to music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, alone in the massive dining room, Vidal shines his boots. Methodically. This is obviously a daily ritual for him. By his side: th two scrawny rabbits he impounded the night before. Mercedes brings him a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Mercedes, prepare these rabbits for dinner tonight. Mercedes eyes the scrawny animals-

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: They are too young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, see if they'll do for a stew.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Yes sir. She turns to leave but Vidal stops her gently.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: And- This coffee- was burnt. Taste it yourself. She does. Vidal places a hand on her shoulder. There is something unpleasant about this sudden contact, something too familiar. She bears it in silence.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: You should keep an eye on it.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. She moves into-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is enormous. The open charcoal cook stove is meters high by five meters wide.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (hands out the rabbits) Take them to the table- Two old, stout cooks, JACINTA and PAZ, wash the gigantic work table with boiling water.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (to the others) He didn't like the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: JACINTA
dialogues.text: Agh- He's nothing but a fussy dandy. A  dandy! MERCEDES picks up a pail of hot water.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: We're going to need some beef and one more chicken. We have more guests- Conchita, Paloma and two other GIRLS pluck chickens, peel potatoes, etc.

dialogues.speaker: PAZ
dialogues.text: Well, where are we supposed to find that?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: The doctor's wife and the mayor's, too.

dialogues.speaker: JACINTA
dialogues.text: Well, they eat more than a pig.

dialogues.speaker: PAZ
dialogues.text: And they don't shut up-

dialogues.speaker: JACINTA
dialogues.text: -not even underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes and Conchita empty buckets of hot water into a porcelain bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmen opens one of her travel trunks.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Ofelia. Your father is giving a dinner party tonight... Look what I've made you. She lifts out a beautiful green dress in shiny silk and ivory tulle. Ofelia studies the dress as if it were a strange artifac rather than something she might wear. Mercedes enters wit breakfast tray.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Do you like it? What I wouldn't have given to have a dress as fine as this when I was little. In a reverie, Carmen takes out a pair of new patent leath shoes and a green silk hair ribbon.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: (to Ofelia) And look at these shoes! Do you like them? Ofelia makes an effort and smiles a weak smile. OFELIA. Yes, they are very pretty. But Carmen is not fooled-

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Go on, now. Take your bath. Go- Ofelia obeys- She enters-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia, alone in the bathroom, opens the magical book. At first, the page is blank, but a wondrous image takes shap Ofelia and five chestnuts. Squatting at her side, under a huge tree: a massive TOAD. Then a KNOCK on the door-

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Ofelia-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone now, Carmen readies the little green dress.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Hurry up. I want to see the dress on you. I want you to be beautiful for the Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On her right shoulder, Ofelia examines, exactly as the Fa said, a birthmark in the form of the crescent moon... CARMENвЂ™S VOICE You'll look like a princess- Ofelia smiles. OFELIA. (to herself) ...a princess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes organizes the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Make sure those chickens are cleaned properly... and the beans... Mercedes takes out a small, sharp knife from the folds in her apron. She skillfully chops an onion. The bustle suddenly stops. Everyone looks toward the door where, among chicken feathers floating like confetti, Ofe stands, dressed in green silk.

dialogues.speaker: CONCHITA
dialogues.text: You look marvelous, my girl, just gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a dress!! Mercedes smiles. She's pleased too, but she claps her han together-

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Get back to work, stop wasting time. They obey. Mercedes goes next to Ofelia.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Do want some milk with honey? Ofelia nods eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes puts a bucket under a huge milk cow.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Step back, I don't want you getting milk on your dress, with you looking so pretty. Mercedes begins to milk the cow. OFELIA. Mercedes, do you believe in fairies?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: No. But when I was a little girl, I did. I believed in a lot of things that I don't believe any more. OFELIA. Well, last night, a fairy visited me. And it wasn't alone, there were lots of them - and a faun, too.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: A faun?? Mercedes picks up the bucket and fills a wooden bow! wit milk. OFELIA. He was very old, very tall and smelled like dirt.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: My mother warned me to be wary of fauns- Suddenly, Vidal and GarcГ©s approach them.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Mercedes, come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal and Mercedes walk toward the bodega, or storage building, adjoining the mill. Guards unload giant sacks of provisions from trucks. A Ci Guard CAPITAN supervises the operation and greets Vidal.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITAN
dialogues.text: Captain, everything is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men fill the enormous bodega with grain, bottles of wine, barrels of oil, salt and sugar, etc.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITAN
dialogues.text: Flour, salt, oil, medicine, olives, bacon, tobacco... Vidal grabs a packet of tobacco.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Tobacco, huh? Real tobacco!  The CAPITAN hands over some papers with the Falangist letterhead.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITAN
dialogues.text: And the ration cards. Mercedes is stunned by the quantity of food and supplies. Vidal checks the padlock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Mercedes, the key-

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Mercedes hands over the key from her large key ring.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: (to Mercedes) Is this the only copy?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: The only one. Vidal locks the padlock. Yanks on it: nice and strong.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: From now on, I'll carry it. From outside, Serrano calls him.

dialogues.speaker: SERRANO
dialogues.text: Captain!! Vidal hurries over to Serrano who hands him a pair of binoculars and points to something on the horizon-

dialogues.speaker: SERRANO
dialogues.text: Captain, perhaps it's nothing. Through the binoculars, Vidal sees a plume of SMOKE on th horizon.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: It's them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GarcГ©s, Vidal and a few of his men ride through the fore on horseback.

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When the forest was young, a fig tree took root and grew to colossal size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia walks away from the mill and into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When the forest was young, it was home to creatures who were full of magic and wonder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal and his men ride through the forest.

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At the heart of this forest stood a colossal fig tree. The Forest Folk slept in its shadow.

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But now, the tree is dying. Its branches are dry, its trunk old and twisted. Ofelia finds herself under a huge FIG TREE that has twist  into an arch reaching to a nearby crag.

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A monstrous toad has settled in its roots and won't let the tree thrive. Ofelia opens her leather bag. Inside there are five large chestnuts.

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You must put the three magic rocks in its mouth and retrieve a magic key from its insides. Only then will the fig tree flourish again. The tree roots are partly exposed. The tree itself is surrounded by a large mud puddle. Ofelia decides to take off her fancy silk dress. She carefully hangs everything - including her hair ribbon - the tree branches. Finally she's down to only a simple cotton slip and her shoes. As she enters- The wind picks up and moves her hanging dress. Then, a sudden gust sends the hair ribbon flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia crawls slowly; the gaps between the roots are narr and claustrophobic. A few big, black pill bugs are nestled in the mud. Ofelia keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal and his men probe a forest cave. Inside, they find remains of a campfire. Vidal removes a glove and touches embers.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Less than twenty minutes, they left ina hurry. He finds the remains of food and drink.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: A dozen men, at most... In the dirt, he discovers the remains of the package the doctor gave to Mercedes. Inside he finds empty antibiotics containers.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Antibiotics... GarcГ©s comes upon a half-burnt lottery ticket.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: (showing him the lottery ticket) Shit- They forgot this lottery ticket. Vidal motions for silence.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: They're here. Those bastards are here and they are watching us. He stands in rapt silence. The trees sway gently. He heft the empty package like a trophy.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: You left this behind! And the lottery ticket! Come back and get it!! This could be your lucky day - ! Silence. Then, they mount up and ride off. Invisible under the trees, six GUERRILLAS are indeed watching. Among them is PEDRO, a tall and serious young m  Ina flash, they all disappear into the underbrush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia's progress is slow. Water oozes from the surroundi roots and mud. Bugs crawl on her arms. She hears a sudden, soggy movement up ahead. She takes ou the five chestnuts - which are so large they barely fit i her hands - and works her way toward the noise. Soon, she comes face to face with- -an immense TOAD, as big as a boar. His golden eyes blink his cheeks puff rhythmically in and out. OFELIA. Hi- The Toad's long tongue flicks out, trapping a couple of beetles and pulling them back into his mouth. Their chitinous shells crunch noisily in its slimy jaws. Ofelia shudders and tries to stand up. As she speaks, a large red pill bug clings to her cheek. OFELIA. lam- I'm princess Moanna and I'm not afraid of you- The Toad observes her, unmoved. OFELIA. Aren't you ashamed? Living down here, eating all the pill bugs and getting fat while the tree dies! FWAPPPP!!!! The Toad sends out its soft pink tongue, whic flattens against her face, then slides off, taking the pi bug and leaving a gelatinous goo. Three of the chestnuts roll to the ground. Ofelia spits disgust. The Toad hunkers down, shaking violently as it croaks. Ofelia backpedals, frightened. The Toad resumes its resti position. Ofelia scoops up the chestnuts. Two fall back into the mu She kneels to get them and- -deftly palms a juicy, fat pill bug. It curls itself into tight ball. She keeps it in the same hand as the chestnut The Toad croaks again, shoots out its tongue, which wraps around her wrist. She stays calm. When the tongue retract covering her hand with viscous spittle, the pill bug is gone. And so are the chestnuts. The Toad croaks violently and suddenly burps up a giganti pearly bubble, which floats in the air, bathed in blood a saliva. And with this, the Toad shrivels away, like a serpent shedding its skin. Ofelia picks up the warty, empty skin and looks at the bubble. In its center: aGOLD KEY. Ofelia plunges her hands into the bubble to grab it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia emerges from under the tree with the golden key in hand. She's filthy, sweaty and exhausted. She nears the place where she left her dress- -but it's not there! After a brief search, she finds her hair ribbon. Covered mud. A few meters away, the dress- covered in wet, mossy mud. It starts to rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of BENTLEYS sweeps into the driveway. Elegant dinn guests get out of the cars: the MAYOR, his WIFE, and a parish PRIEST. Vidal stands at the front door to greet them. He's in his formal uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmen, in a velvet maternity dress and in her wheelchair wrings her hands in anguish. The dining room is looking i best, with sparkling crystal and china at each place setting.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: (to Mercedes) Have you checked in her room?? And the garden??

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Yes, madam. The VOICES of the dinner guests get louder. As Vidal ente

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: May I introduce you to my wife, Carmen. Carmen manages a wan smile of greeting. The Mayor's wife smiles back-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enchanted.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Pleasure to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ration card with the Falangist stamps on it. The Mayor examines it.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: From now on- one ration card peer family. Seated around the table are: the doctor and his WIFE, the wife, GarcГ©s, Serrano, Carmen, the Guardia Civil Capitan Carmen is stony-faced in her distraction.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: One?? Captain, I'm not sure it'll be enough.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: If people are careful, it should be plenty. He eats more potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: What we can't allow is for anyone to send food to the guerillas in the mountains. They're losing ground - and one of them is wounded.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Captain, how can you be so sure?

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: We almost got them today. They had this. Vidal pulls out one of the antibiotic vials.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Antibiotics. Mercedes briefly catches the Doctor's eye.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: God has already saved their souls. What happens to their bodies, well, it hardly matters to Him.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: We'll help you in any way we can, Captain. We know youвЂ™re not here by choice- Vidal pauses and locks eyes with him.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: You're wrong about that. The guests grow silent.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: I choose to be here because I want my son to be born in a clean, new Spain. Because these people have the idea that we're all alike. But there's a big difference: The war is over and we won. And if we need to kill each of those motherfuckers to agree on it, then we'll kill them all. And thatвЂ™s that. He raises his glass and toasts.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: We're all here by choice. All the guests raise their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: By choice. Mercedes quickly leaves the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen door opens and Mercedes enters, trembling. On the verge of tears, she grabs a lantern and readies to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Put the coffee on. I'm going for more wood. She leaves the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mill receding in the distance, Mercedes hurries uphil She pauses next to a large wood pile and sadly gazes at t forest. Using her hand to shield the lantern's light she signals woods- one, two, three times. Then she turns around- She sees-

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Ofelia- Shivering, covered in mud, Ofelia climbs downhill and int MercedesвЂ™s arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone eats with relish, impeccably attended by the kitchen staff.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR'S WIFE
dialogues.text: And- How did you and the Captain meet? Vidal seems uncomfortable but Carmen gently touches his  hand.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Ofelia's father was a tailor - he used to make the CaptainвЂ™s uniforms-

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR'S WIFE
dialogues.text: I see-

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: -and after he died, I went to work at the shop. A little more than a year ago, the Captain and I met again... Vidal moves his hand away from Carmen's.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR'S WIFE
dialogues.text: Curious, isn't it? Finding each other after such a long time.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR'S WIFE
dialogues.text: Curious indeed- very curious...

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Please, forgive my wife. She hasn't been exposed to the world. She thinks these silly stories are interesting to others. Carmen grows silent. Ashamed. Mercedes discreetly comes over to Carmen and speaks to he Carmen pushes back from the table.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Please, excuse me. All the men get up as Carmen leaves the dining room. The Guardia Civil Capitan smiles at Vidal.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITAN
dialogues.text: Have I told you that I was acquainted with your father, Captain? Vidal can't suppress a brief grimace.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: No- I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITAN
dialogues.text: In Morocco. I met him only briefly, but he left a great impression. Vidal chews his food nervously.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: An excellent soldier.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITAN
dialogues.text: The men in his battalion said that when General Vidal died on the battlefield, he smashed his watch on a rock so that his son would know the exact hour and minute of his death. So he would know how a brave man dies. All eyes turn to Vidal.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITAN
dialogues.text: Nonsense. He didn't own a watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia is floating on the warm water of the tub.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: What you've done hurts me. When you get out of the tub, you'll go to bed without dinner. Ofelia listens in silence, holding back.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Are you listening? Sometimes | think you'll never learn to behave. You've disappointed me, and your father, too.  OFELIA. The Captain?

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Yes- Him more than me. The faintest trace of satisfaction is visible on Ofelia's face. Carmen leaves. The Green Fairy flies in through the open window. Ofelia greets it. OFELIA. I've got the key. Take me to the labyrinth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the book and the key in hand, Ofelia steps to the center of the well. She is wearing a striped robe. She examines the engravings on the monolith: the Faun, embracing a girl and a baby.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: That's me and the girl is you. From out of the shadows comes the Faun. The Green Fairy hurries to him.

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA
dialogues.text: And the baby? The Faun comes near Ofelia chewing a chunk of raw meat.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: I see that you got the key- The Green Fairy lands on his shoulder. He feeds her some

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: She's very glad you succeeded. She's believed in you from the very start.  Keep the key. You'll be needing it. And this also- Out of nowhere he produces a piece of white chalk.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: a piece of chalk- Ofelia takes the chalk.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: There are still two tasks left and the moon is almost full. Be patient. He caresses her face with his dirty hands, which are cove with creeping bugs.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: We'll soon be strolling through the seven circular gardens of your palace. OFELIA. How do I know that what you say is true?? As he comes closer, the Faun's face again comes into the light. A wicked grin is revealed-

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: Why would a poor little faun like me lie to you? Ofelia leaves the well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIDAL opens the warehouse. A large CROWD OF PEOPLE lines up for rations. The soldiers keep order as Vidal supervises the distribut of wheat, cooking oil and tobacco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceed.

dialogues.speaker: SERRANO
dialogues.text: Have your cards in hand and ready. Let's go. Your name? In a logbook, he makes note of every handout. Mercedes, Conchita and Paz come out of the granary carryi baskets of bread. Each piece is contained in a brown bag with a legend printed. The Guardia Civil Capitan grabs a piece and starts reciting the printed legend.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITAN
dialogues.text: This is our daily bread in Franco's Spain! Which we keep safe in this mill. The Reds lie when they say there's hunger in Spain. Because in a united Spain, there's not a single home without a warm fire or without bread. Mercedes looks toward the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia wakes up next to her mother. She quietly slips out bed; her mother sleeps on. As Ofelia reaches the middle o the room, her mother moans softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia opens the special book. Impatient, she starts turn the pages- NOTHING. She keeps flipping through, looking and looking. But each page fades to white. Ofelia looks at a beam of sunlight coming in from the sm bathroom window. She reaches out her hand and plays with She looks down at a page in the book. A small red stain h appeared. Blood. It spreads rapidly, until it covers the whole page. Frightened, Ofelia drops the book. The blood flows onto t next page and covers it, too. Ofelia notices a bloodstain on her nightgown. She steps back. Opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (weak) Ofelia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia returns to her mother. Huge torrents of blood flow from the bed onto the floor. Carmen extends a bloody hand toward the girl.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: (barely a whisper) Ofelia... help me... She gets out of bed; the lower half of her body is completely bloody. Ofelia runs to her. Carmen disappears from her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia hurries from the building and goes to Vidal, who supervises the food rationing. OFELIA. Captain! Come quickly!  CAMERA pulls back to follow Vidal as he runs inside the mill. The day is just beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItвЂ™s raining. Vidal and the Doctor stand near the front entrance:

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Your wife needs absolute bed rest. She'll be sedated from now on. The girl should sleep somewhere else. I'll stay here until the birth.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Take care of her. Heal her. I don't care what it costs or what you need, make her well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia surveys the filthy attic and the dark, low ceiling full of holes. Mercedes and Conchita make a bed with a large comforter a several fluffy pillows. Conchita leaves.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Don't worry. Your mother will get better soon, you'll see. Having a baby is complicated. Ofelia shakes her head. OFELIA.  Then I'll never have a one. Mercedes sits by her side. OFELIA. You are helping the men in the woods, aren't you? This comes out of the blue. Mercedes freezes and after a long beat:

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Have you told anyone? OFELIA. No, I haven't- I don't want anything bad happening to you.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Or me to you- They embrace softly. OFELIA. Do you know a lullaby?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Only one, but I don't remember the words. OFELIA. I don't care. I still want to hear it. As she sings we-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes is alone in the kitchen. She carries a canvas ba There is a low flame burning on the charcoal range. She kneels down and removes a tile from the floor: she ha hidden some food, a bottle of Orujo and some papers. She transfers everything to the canvas bag. Someone comes int  the kitchen, startling her.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: DonвЂ™t be afraid- itвЂ™s just me-- Mercedes exhales, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Well, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FOREST / RIVER- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Carrying the bag, Mercedes walks through the river with t Doctor. They stop in front of a large, half-cut tree.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: This is sheer madness. When that man finds out about us, he'll kill us all. Have you thought about that?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Are you that afraid of him, Doctor? After a long beat-

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: It's not fear, at least not for myself. A noise. Then silence. The tree trunks sway and creak softly. Something moves among the trees... Mercedes takes a couple steps... and suddenly, someone is there: it is Pedro, the young guerrilla. He hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Pedro, Pedro- My brother. He kisses her on both cheeks. The Doctor looks around wi alarm as twenty more men appear from out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia is lying in bed.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You refused the task - Ofelia is startled: the Faun is perched on the foot rail bed, like a big crow. OFELIA. N-no- my mother is sick.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: That's no excuse for negligence. The Faun looks in a tattered bag, takes out a twisted roo of MANDRAKE.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: Look, this is a mandrake root. A plant that dreamt of being human. Put it under your mother's bed in a bow] of fresh milk. Each morning give it two drops of blood. Ofelia, revolted, takes the root.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: Now, we have no time to waste. The full moon will be upon us. Let my pets guide you through-- He hands her his basket. The Fairies chitter-chatter insi it.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You're going to a very dangerous place,  so be careful. The thing that slumbers there, it's not human... He hands her a small, dark hourglass.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You will see a sumptuous banquet, but don't eat or drink anything. Your life depends on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes, Pedro and the Doctor arrive at a large cave mou GUERILLA sentries allow them to pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are covered with soot. A dozen more guerillas sit around an open fire in the mid of the cave. Mercedes opens up the canvas bag and starts handing out letters, food, tobacco and newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I've brought some Orujo, tobacco, cheese. Some mail for "Trigo" and "Piloto.". The men divide a newspaper among themselves. One page eac The doctor approaches a group of wounded men. One of them FRENCHIE, is very weak. His leg is bandaged.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: LetВ«s see how that leg is doing, Frenchie-

dialogues.speaker: FRENCHIE
dialogues.text: Well, how do you think itвЂ™s doing?? It's  fucked up-

dialogues.speaker: STUTTER
dialogues.text: .. North American, B-b-british and C-c canadian T-t-troops disemb-b-barked on a small beach in the North of F-F-france- STUTTER, a thin guy in his thirties, reads a ragged newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: TRIGO
dialogues.text: Gimme that, you stammering piece of shit! Muscle-bound TRIGO grabs the newspaper from Stutter.

dialogues.speaker: TRIGO
dialogues.text: More than 150,000 soldiers... under the command of General Dwight D. Eisenhower who said: "We will not accept anything less than complete victory over Germany." The Doctor cuts the bandages off Frenchie's leg. It looks horrible.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCHIE
dialogues.text: Is it bad, doctor?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Look, Frenchie- There's no way to save it. Everyone goes quiet-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor readies a stainless steel bone saw.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I'll try to do it in as few cuts as I can. The men give Frenchie the bottle. He gulps down half of i

dialogues.speaker: FRENCHIE
dialogues.text: (stoically) Wait a second, doctor, just a second. Frenchie looks longingly at his leg. One last time- Then, takes hold of Trigo and Rubio's arms. Mercedes and Pedro all their weight on the injured limb. The Doctor touches his saw to the leg- -and cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia takes the book out from under her bed. Opening it, she sees herself illustrated in a room with a lavish tabl full of food. In the wall are three niches. And at the fa end of the table, a pale human figure.

dialogues.speaker: OFELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Use the chalk to trace a door anywhere in your room. Open it and start the hourglass - let yourself be guided by the Fairies- Ofelia draws the outline of a door on the wall... and the opens it onto a long hallway. Ofelia goes through, wearin the wicker basket around her neck. OFELIA. Don't eat or drink anything and come back before the last grain of sand falls through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl walks down a corridor with a low ceiling and a multitude of arches. Each column represents a tree with fanning branches. An elaborate mosaic pattern spreads ove the floor; the ceiling fresco depicts the lunar cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next room, a large, wooden table overflows with a cornucopia of cakes, meat, fish, liquor, exotic fruits... Light and warmth pour forth from a roaring fireplace. A PALE MAN with a gaunt, featureless face and skeletal bo sits silently at the far end of the table. He's ominously still, his head hanging at an odd angle. I front of him, a small metallic plate displays two human eyeballs. It's very hot: beads of sweat roll down Ofelia's face. He hungry stomach growls. She spots the three niches. She takes out her golden key and considers the doors. Eac one clad in smooth gold, with identical locks. The wicker basket starts to shake furiously. Ofelia opens it. The Fairies fly out. They buzz around the three niches, like flies around hone They fan their wings repeatedly, vibrating, communicating sniffing the gold doors. Stepping back to let the Fairies investigate, Ofelia knoc over a platter of green grapes. She picks them up and puts them back on the table. One of the grapes remains on the floor. The Green Fairy stops in front of the door in the middle, announcing its decision. Ofelia goes to the door and puts the key in the lock. OFELIA. No- It's this one- -she goes to the adjoining door, sticks the key in the lo  and turns it. CLACK. She opens the door and reaches through the doorway to tak whatever is there. Her hand nears a package, about 16 centimeters long, wrap ina dirty rag. Ofelia looks around: nothing has happened. All is calm. T Pale Man is immobile. Ofelia readies to exit, but then she spots a plate full o ripe grapes: so many of them!! She looks back at the eerie, sitting figure: immobile and seemingly lifeless. The Fairies warn her repeatedly, tryi to prevent her from eating any grapes. But the girl sneak picks one up and eats it. Unseen by her- The Pale Man lifts his head and grabs the human eyeballs from the metallic plate in front of him. He introduces the eyeballs into twin stigmatas in his pal and uses his hands to look around, splaying his fingers l excited peacock feathers as he discovers- -Ofelia eating yet another grape. The Pale Man jerks toward her, in spastic, disembodied steps. He crouches like an animal ready to pounce. Ofelia turns just in time. The Pale Man roars. The Fairie fly at him and attack! Flailing his arms, the monster turns over the table, dump all the food. Swatting and snapping, he eats two of the Fairies. They HOWL as he bites down... Ofelia runs, carrying the precious package. The Green Fai follows her. The Pale Man comes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia gets to the end of the hallway. She pounds the bl wall where moments ago there was a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia's thumping is barely audible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia sees the Pale Man's silhouette coming up the hallw Ofelia searches her pockets for the chalk. Finding it, sh stands on tiptoe and traces the outline of a door! Ofelia pushes against it and opens-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trapdoor in the attic floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia crawls out the new exit. Her legs dangle briefly. The pale monster leaps at them, snarling. Ofelia pulls herself up and out just in time. The Green Fairy follows thereafter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia slams the door behind her. The marks on the floor disappear and it seals itself shut. All the while, something directly below bumps violently, almost bursting through the floor.  When all is calm, Ofelia sits on the bed, exhausted. The Green Fairy flutters and chirps, excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor, Mercedes and Pedro start down the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: PEDRO
dialogues.text: We'll soon have reinforcements from Jaca. Fifty men or more. Then we'll go head to head with Vidal.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: And then what- ? You kill him, they'll send another just like him. And another...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The Doctor washes his bloody hands and his surgical instruments in the stream that runs through the mountains

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You're screwed, no guns, no roof over your heads... You need food, medicine. You should take care of Mercedes. If you really loved her, you would cross the border with her. This is a lost cause.

dialogues.speaker: PEDRO
dialogues.text: I'm staying here, Doctor. ThereвЂ™s no choice. He moves away, towards Mercedes, who awaits him nearby. S hands him a copy of the warehouse KEY.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: HereвЂ™s the key- but you can't come down now. It's exactly what he wants-  He kisses her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: PEDRO
dialogues.text: Leave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I'ma coward.

dialogues.speaker: PEDRO
dialogues.text: No, you're not.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Yes, I am- a coward for living next to that sonofabitch, making his bed, feeding him... What if the Doctor's right and we cannot win? Pedro looks at Mercedes, hugs her fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: PEDRO
dialogues.text: Well- At least we'll make things harder for that bastard. A SONG starts up, full of good cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once more, Vidal, shirtless, is shaving with his switchbl while listening to music on the Victrola. On the sink: his father's gold and silver watch. Vidal looks at it and then studies himself in the mirror, if sizing up an old enemy. He places the steel blade on h own reflection and- -cuts swiftly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music drifts upstairs into the Upper bedroom. Ofelia approaches her mother, who is asleep in bed, sweat profusely. She caresses her face. There is a breakfast tray on the night stand. Ofelia empties a glass of milk into a bowl and pulls the mandrake root out from under her clothing. She submerges in the milk, then slides the bowl under the bed. She bites her finger until a small drop of blood appears. falls into the milk... The mandrake twitches, sucking avidly at the pink liquid. The root uncoils into the floor, spiralling around the le of the bed-frame. Ofelia hears FOOTSTEPS: somebody's coming into the bedroo Ofelia stays down: she can see a pair of shoes. It is the Doctor. He checks Carmen's pulse and temperatur

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Captain Vidal! Vidal paces nervously, nearby-

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Her temperature is down...

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: But she still has a fever?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Yes, but it's a good sign- her body is responding. Vidal stares at the Doctor, not a trace of emotion in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Listen to me. If you have to choose, save the baby. That boy will bear my name and my father's name, too. Ofelia hears this from beneath the bed. Suddenly an explosion shakes the room. Vidal looks outsid then another explosion rattles the windows. Bits of plaster drop down from the ceiling onto the groun near Ofelia. Cursing, Vidal rushes from the bedroom. The Doctor follow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal hurries out to the garden. The guards have come out their tents and look at- -a colossal column of smoke and fire in the distance. Another explosion shakes the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia comes out from beneath the bed. Tentatively, she n her mother's belly. OFELIA. Brother, brother, if you can hear me... She leans her head gently on it. OFELIA. ...things out here aren't too good. And soon you'll have to come out. Mom isn't doing well. Unexpectedly, the girl tears up. OFELIA. I'm asking you for one thing, just one: don't hurt her.  She's very pretty, you'll see. Even though she's sad some of the time. You'll see, when she smiles - you'll love her. So- if you do what I say, I'll make you a Prince in my kingdom... I promise you- a Prince...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something has blown a large crater into the rural railroa track. Tipped into it is the smoking ruin of a locomotive Vidal inspects a couple of charred BODIES by the wreckage

dialogues.speaker: ENGINEER
dialogues.text: I sounded the whistle- but they wouldn't move. I tried to stop, but it was too late- The long freight train has derailed in the middle of nowhere. Dozens of GUARDIAS CIVIL patrol the disaster. The engineer and the FIREMAN walk among the burned freigh cars with Vidal and his men. Some GUARDIAS CIVIL ride up dismount.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: What did they steal from inside the freight cars?

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: Nothing They didn't open a single one.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: This whole mess- and they didn't open any of the cars. They didn't take anything.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Nothing, are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, who the hell knows that they wanted- other than to make us waste our time. And, just as Vidal realizes he's been tricked. The sound DISTANT GUNFIRE reaches his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain is falling as Vidal's Bentley roars to a stop in fro of the mill. A gunfight is raging. Staying low, the Captain runs over GarcГ©s. There are several cadavers strewn on the ground. Guards have taken cover among the trees. Some bloody, wounded soldiers cower on the ground. GarcГ©s is bleeding from a wound on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: (pointing) Captain- they came out of nowhere- They have grenades... Vidal sees the open bodega. It has been thoroughly looted jugs and empty crates are scattered everywhere. He takes special note of- -the open lock, hanging from the door. Serrano hurries up to him.

dialogues.speaker: SERRANO
dialogues.text: One group stayed behind - up on the cliff- with rifles... We've surrounded them-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding his gun, Vidal advances on foot through the dripp forest. He is accompanied by a squad of guards. GUNSHOTS. A pair of GUERRILLAS jumps out from a pile of boulders, blasting away. A guard falls down dead at Vidal feet, three bullets in his chest. Vidal, Serrano and GarcГ©s take cover behind a craggy outcropping. Bullets explode onto the stone. Excited, Vidal glances at his Father's watch and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: CвЂ™mon, Serrano, this is the only decent way to die. He leaps out, firing. Two bullets whiz by his head and bu themselves in a tree. Vidal keeps shooting, wounding two of the guerrillas. Gar follows, also firing. Vidal and GarcГ©s get to- -the boulders: kneeling there is a YOUNG GUERRILLA, panti torn to pieces by the gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Let me see- Can you talk?? The Young Guerrilla gasps for air: a gaping wound on his neck bleeds profusely.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Pity. He empties his pistol into the Young Guerrilla. GarcГ©s i appalled. Vidal reloads and finishes off the second one w a shot to the temple.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: (to Serrano) This is useless- we need one alive- Just one-  GarcГ©s spots something nearby. Lurking in the bushes is a WOUNDED MAN, gasping for air, wounded in the leg. His face remains hidden.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Captain, this oneвЂ™s still alive. He's got a leg wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes comes down the service stairs into the kitchen. runs to the window. All the kitchen maids are there.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: CONCHITA
dialogues.text: They took one of them- alive. And they're taking him to the storeroom. Mercedes darts out into the rain.

dialogues.speaker: CONCHITA
dialogues.text: Mercedes! Mercedes heads toward the old bodega. She sees the guards drag a man inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes stands, in the middle of the rain not knowing wh to do- where to go- where to run-  Vidal approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Mercedes?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I-I needed to get in the bodega-

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Not now, Mercedes. A guard comes out. Mercedes can see-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -the prisoner is Stutter. Stutter and Mercedes look each other in the eye- There is a mixture of relief and pity in Mercedes! eyes. A guard closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes takes the hidden knife from her apron and peels vegetables. Rapidly and mechanically. The kitchen is bustling with activity, but her mind is miles away. She picks up a dinner tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She carries the tray upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She places the tray on the night stand. Carmen and Ofelia play card games by the light of the oil lamp. The Doctor readies Carmen daily doze of sleeping medicati into a glass of water for Carmen.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: This is half the dose: only one drop- As Ofelia comes to the bedside, a weak but conscious Carm pushes the medicine away.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: I don't think I need it. I feel better.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I don't understand it. But IвЂ™m glad. Ofelia smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal finishes rolling a cigarette. He's standing in fron of Stutter, who is tied to a concrete post.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Damn! This cigarette is good. Real good tobacco- He offers him a puff.

dialogues.speaker: STUTTER
dialogues.text: F-f-f-fuck you- GarcГ©s enters and sets down a table and some chairs.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: We catch one and he turns out to be a stutterer. Fuck! We'll be here all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as he talks, Captain-

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: GarcГ©s is right- You better tell us everything. Because, to make it happen, I brought along a few tools. Nothing fancy- Things you pick up along the way. He goes over to a tool box and takes out a hammer, some needle-nose pliers and a leather-working blade.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: At first I won't be able to trust you.. But when I use this one- He lifts the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: - you'll own up to a few things... Next, he shows off the pliers.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: When we get to this one, we'll have a closer relationship, almost like brothers. You'll see. He picks up the blade.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: And when we get to this one, I'll believe everything you tell me. Vidal picks up the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Now- I'll make you a deal. If you can count to three without st-t-tuttering, you can go. He approaches the shivering man, who looks around as if i search of an answer.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Don't look around, look at me. There's no  one above me. GarcГ©s- If I say this asshole can leave-

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Then he can leave, Captain-

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: So, there- count to three. And Stutter tries- sweating- making a supreme effort-

dialogues.speaker: STUTTER
dialogues.text: One-

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Good. Again, Stutter struggles and manages a-

dialogues.speaker: STUTTER
dialogues.text: Two.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: One more and you will be free. And he goes for it. But-

dialogues.speaker: STUTTER
dialogues.text: T--t-t-t- He looks up at Vidal, imploring.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Pity. His arm is a blur as the hammer lands a terrible blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder, lightning, it's raining again. Ofelia is asleep her bed. A shadow passes over her body-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother is much better, Your Highness- You must be relieved!! Ofelia is startled awake. The Faun looms over her. OFELIA. Yes, thank you. But things haven't turned out so well.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: No?? She gives him the package. The Faun opens it: inside ther is a long, gold dagger. It's beautiful. The blade is engraved with Celtic lettering and on the handle is the figure of a satyr hugging a girl who holds a baby. OFELIA. No. I had an accident.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: An accident?? She hands him the Fairy basket. Out of it comes the damag Green Fairy, who immediately perches atop his shoulder an starts chattering and pointing at the girl.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You broke the rules! OFELIA. It was just two grapes! I thought no one would notice-

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: We made a mistake!! OFELIA. A mistake?

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You failed. You can never go back. The moon will be full in three days.  Your spirit will stay forever among humans. You'll live among them, you'll get old like them, you'll die like them-- and your memory of us will fade. And we'll vanish along with it! The Faun backs into the darkest corner of the attic.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You will never, ever see us again. A flash of lightning briefly illuminates the corner: The Faun is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal calmly smokes a cigarette under an umbrella. GarcГ© arrives with the Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Good day, Doctor. Sorry to wake you so early, but I think we need some help. The Doctor goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor comes into the bodega. Vidal stays at the door Stutter is curled up on the ground. His nose is flattened one eye is bloodshot and a head wound is bleeding. Flies buzz around him.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: My God, what have you done to him?

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Not much. But things are getting better. Vidal surreptitiously removes a vial of antibiotics from Doctor's medical bag. He wraps it in a linen handkerchief

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: I like having you near, Doctor. It has its advantages. He moves away along with GarcГ©s.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Serrano, stay here- Once alone, the Doctor opens up his bag and takes out som alcohol and gauze to clean the wounds.

dialogues.speaker: STUTTER
dialogues.text: I spoke. Not much- b-b-but I did- The Doctor sees the man's hand: it's a mess of broken bon and lacerations.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I'm sorry- He glances at Serrano, outside smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: STUTTER
dialogues.text: No... Kill me, kill me now. The Doctor looks him in the eye, unsurprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal brings out the packet of medicine from the cave. He takes out a vial of antibiotics and compares it with the from the Doctor's bag. They are identical.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor prepares an injection.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: (to Stutter, in a whisper) It will be over soon. Stutter gratefully squeezes his hand. After a brief hesitation, the Doctor administers the injection. The men stare at one another. Slowly, the life ebbs from Stutter's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal briskly leaves his study. Hearing a door click shut somewhere above- he stops-

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: (to GarcГ©s) Go check on Doctor Ferreiro. I'll be there soon.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Yes, Captain. Vidal goes upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia is crawling under the bed- There she finds the mandrake root, bloated and immobile. OFELIA. You're not moving- are you ill? Suddenly, Vidal yanks her out from under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing down there? Vidal looks underneath the dust ruffle-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GarcГ©s walks to the bodega. Serrano snuffs out his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Where is he? Call him out here-

dialogues.speaker: SERRANO
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Who do you think, you idiot? Ferreiro! He pushes Serrano aside, enters the bodega-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor holds the dying Stutter in his arms. GarcГ©s s -the syringe in his hands. He understands immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIDAL drags out the mandrake root from under the bed. Its foul smell makes him wince.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? He rips it off the milk plate.  OFELIA. No! Nooo! Vidal is about to hit the girl when-

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Please, leave her be! Vidal turns: Carmen has awakened. She motions for him to stop.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Look what she hid under your bed?! What do you think of this? He hands Carmen the mandrake root. Ashen-faced and weak, Carmen looks at the disgusting thing, trying to make sens of it.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Ofelia, what is this doing under the bed? OFELIA. (matter of fact) It's a magic root the Faun gave me!

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: This is all because of that junk you let her read. Look what you've done-

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Leave us alone, I'll speak to her, Darling...

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: As you wish. Vidal, furious, leaves the room. OFELIA. The Faun told me you would get better - and you did!

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: You have to listen to your father. You  have to stop all this. Ofelia hugs her mother with all her might. OFELIA. No- I want to leave this place! Please, let's just go -

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Things are not that simple. Carmen pries her off and looks her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: As you get older, you'll see that life isn't like your fairy tales. The world is a cruel place. She moves away and near the open chimney. The firelight cast shadows over her sweaty face.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: And you'll learn that, even if it hurts. She throws the root into the fire!! OFELIA. Noooo!!

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Ofelia!! Magic does not exist! She grabs the girl by the shoulders, shaking her.

dialogues.speaker: CARMEN
dialogues.text: Not for you, me or anyone else! Then- a horrible, inhuman squeal. The dying shriek of the mandrake!!! Ofelia watches in horror as the humanoid root writhes and squeals in the chimney flames!!! Carmen gasps and doubles over in pain, clutching her stomach. Ofelia holds her as best as she can. OFELIA. Help, help, help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ddoctor and Vidal study each other.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: It was the only thing I could do.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: No. You could have obeyed me?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I could have. But I did not. From somewhere in the house, someone CRIES OUT. They hear commotion among the servants. The Doctor stands up and collects his bag.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: But it would have been better for you- Vidal grips his arm, stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: I don't understand- Why didn't you obey me?? A long beat. The Doctor knows that his response will seal his fate.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: To obey without thinking- just like that- Well- that's something only people like you can do- Captain- Vidal takes out his gun and shoots the Doctor, who drops the ground. Vidal stands over him and finishes him off. A stunned GarcГ©s looks on. It begins to rain. Jacinta an Conchita approach Vidal- an urgent murmur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GarcГ©s!! Have the troop paramedic come to my wife's room right away!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stream of servants hustles up and down the stairs with steaming basins and clean towels. Some go in and out of t bedroom. The SOUND of Carmen's screams.
