Vidal and Ofelia wait impatiently outside the bedroom. Beyond the half-open door: chaos. Mercedes washes her blo hands in a wash basin. Ofelia listens to her mother's cries. Carmen's screams stop, replaced by a NEWBORN'S CRY. The PARAMEDIC walks towards Vidal and whispers-

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: Your wife- is dead- Vidal hurries into the room. Ofelia is now alone in the corridor. There's no one aroun She hears the crying infant in her mother's bedroom. A PRIEST's eulogy can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful afternoon: the sun is shining, the sky is cle Gathered around a grave are the Mayor, his wife, the Prie all THE SERVANTS FROM THE MILL, the guards and Vidal in a civilian black dress suit, with his newborn son in his ar Ofelia weeps silently. Mercedes puts her hand on Ofelia' shoulder. They lower the coffin into the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia closes the trunk that held her mother's dresses. S puts away her mother's make-up, letters and photographs. Various medicines and the bottle of sleeping drops are on the night stand. She puts everything into a small suitcas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal wipes a record with his shirt sleeve. He places it the Victrola. Mercedes lays the sleeping baby in a simple wooden cradle

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: You knew the Doctor well, didn't you Mercedes?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: We all knew him, sir. Everyone around here.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: The stutterer spoke of an informant here- inside the mill. Can you imagine that? Right under my nose. Vidal places the needle on the record.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Mercedes, please. He points at an empty seat in front of his desk. The musi starts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What must you think of me, my dear young woman? You must think I'm a monster.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: What someone like me thinks of you- hardly matters, Sir- He pours himself a glass of Orujo and pours one for her a well.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Would you go to the bodega, Mercedes? And bring me another bottle of liquor. Please. He glances at the bottle: a quarter of the liquor still remains.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Yes, sir- right away.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Aren't you forgetting something?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: The key. I have the only copy, don't I?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Y-yes.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: You know? Something's bothering me. It's not important, a tiny detail- but the day they broke into the storehouse, with all those grenades and explosives, the lock itself was never forced. But as I said- It's probably not important. He gives her the key and hovers dangerously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be very careful.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Good night, sir. Vidal watches her leave as he sips his liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music from Vidal's study carries into the kitchen. Mercedes pries up the loose floor tile and fills her canv bag with letters and groceries. She hears a noise, and stops: nothing... She hurriedly keeps packing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia, sound asleep. A shadow looms over her. She wakes

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Shh. Ofelia- I'm leaving tonight. OFELIA. Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I can't tell you. Ofelia puts her arms around her neck. OFELIA. Take me with you, please.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I can't, my child- OFELIA. Take me with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia and Mercedes cautiously move away from the mill. Mercedes uses an old umbrella to shelter the girl from th rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women wade the shallow end of the river. Suddenly noise- Mercedes pauses, agitated.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I heard something- She listens intently.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Nothing- It was nothing. When she turns, she's surprised to discover- Vidal, Serrano and half a dozen men surrounding them. Vid nods at them, gentlemanly.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Mercedes- Then he gazes down at his stepdaughter.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Ofelia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal pushes Ofelia into the attic.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: How long have you known about her?? Uh?? He slaps the girl- twice.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: How you must have laughed at me, you little bitch!! He turns to his men, awaiting orders by the door.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Lock the door- Keep an eye on her and if anyone tries to get in, kill her first. He exits. Leaving the weeping girl alone in the enormous attic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal takes the canvas bag from Mercedes. He opens it and brings out a few meager items.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Dry meat- Tobacco - if you had asked for it, I would have given it to you, Mercedes- Then, a small packet of letters.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: I want the names of anyone named in these letters and I want them in front of me- first thing in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir! GarcГ©s nods he finishes roping Mercedes to the exact sam wooden post where Stutter was tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can leave, GarcГ©s.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: You're sure, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: For God's sake, she's just a woman. GarcГ©s leers and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: That's what you always thought. That's why I was able to get away with it. I was invisible to you. Vidal rolls up his sleeves and unbuttons his shirt collar

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Damn. You found my weakness: arrogance. How perceptive. But weвЂ™re here to find your weak points. Vidal busies himself with his tools: the hammer, pliers,

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: It's very simple: you will talk... and Ihave to know that everything you say is the truth. Straining against the ropes, Mercedes manages reach the knife in her apron.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: At first, I won't be able to trust- Suddenly- WHACK!!! VidalвЂ™s body shudders- -he puts his hand to his left shoulder blade. He looks at his bloody fingers. He turns around and stumbles. Mercedes holds the knife. Vidal reaches for his gun. Mercedes stabs him again, this time deep in his upper ar As Vidal doubles over in pain, she sticks the knife in hi mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: At first, I won't be able to trust- I'm not some old man -! Not a wounded prisoner- ! Sonofabitch- sonofabitch- DonвЂ™t you dare touch the girl... You won't be the first pig I've gutted -! With a brutal thrust - from the inside out - she slices o his cheek. Vidal collapses, gurgling blood. Mercedes uses the knife to cut the ropes as quick as she can. Once free, Mercedes runs toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, no one has any idea of what has just happened. GarcГ©s, Serrano and other guards go about their business GarcГ©s, in fact, is listening to a radio, tuned to the NATIONAL LOTTERY results. He holds in his hand the Guerrilla's abandoned ticket.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: ... the winning numbers are... Mercedes, surreptitious, moves away into the woods. Serra spots her at the last minute.

dialogues.speaker: SERRANO
dialogues.text: (to GarcГ©s) He let her go!

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Shh- He listens to the radio and finally, grunting crumples th lottery ticket and moves towards Serrano.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about?? Serrano points at Mercedes, already halfway into the woo

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Hey! She starts to run. GarcГ©s pulls out his gun and readies Vidal stumbles out of the bodega, bleeding and covering h face with his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: (to GarcГ©s) Get her!!! GarcГ©s is shocked- an injured Vidal???

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Captain! What-??

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Bring her to me, Goddamit!!! He uncovers his slashed face. GarcГ©s, startled runs to comply.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: (to all men) Mount up!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes runs through the trees. Suddenly a rumble makes her turn around: A group of TEN M on horses surges into view. She stumbles, losing ground. Mercedes gets up, limping now- She gets to a clearing. Closing in, GarcГ©s dismounts. Si other riders surround her. Mercedes flashes her knife. Th horsemen tighten the circle around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be better if you come without struggling. The Captain- She puts the blade to her own throat.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: Don't be foolish, sweetheart, if anyone is going to kill you- He takes out his gun.

dialogues.speaker: GARCES
dialogues.text: It'll be me- He walks up to her. Suddenly, a gunshot hits him in the chest, and then another and another. He falls to the grou dead. A series of gunshots pick off the other horsemen. The last three soldiers try to escape. One is killed by a furious hail of bullets; Serrano and another one manage t get away. A blood-spattered Mercedes sees men emerging from the forest: Pedro now leads FORTY ARMED GUERRILLAS. Brother and sister embrace. The Guerillas finish off the injured soldiers on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia lies on the floor, motionless, defeated, when the Green Fairy appears. Ofelia sits up, and the Faun is there.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: I've decided to give you one last chance.  Mesmerized, Ofelia nods.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You promise to listen, to do everything I tell you? Without question? Ofelia nods again.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: Very well, then: Pick up your brother and bring him to the labyrinth- as fast as you can. Your Highness... OFELIA. My brother?

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: We need him. OFELIA. Why-

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: (irritated) No more questions. OFELIA. The door's locked. The Faun gives her piece of chalk.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: Then, create your own door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serrano and the injured soldier return to the mill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal sews his split cheek and then wraps a blood-staine bandage around it. Ofelia steals in, past the Captain's desk. In the cradle, the baby starts crying. The baby's wails grow louder. The Captain turns around; Ofelia hides but leaves her magic chalk behind. Vidal goes to a small table and serves himself the last o the Orujo. He's takes a sip. The bandage soaks up in bloo and alcohol. He grunts- -and pours himself another one. He's about to take a sip when he sees the chalk on his de He instinctively readies his gun... Then-

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Captain- Captain- Please come, quickly-

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Serrano is back. He's wounded.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Wounded? He leaves the study. Ofelia comes out from hiding and loo at the cradle, at the crying infant. She takes out her mother's bottle of sleeping medicine an empties it into Vidal's liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen men gather around the WOUNDED GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: What happened?? Where is GarcГ©s??  Serrano shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: How many were there?

dialogues.speaker: WOUNDED GUARD
dialogues.text: I don't know, sir. The shots came from all around us. Fifty- at least-

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: None of the watch posts are responding, Sir-

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: How many men here in camp?

dialogues.speaker: SERRANO
dialogues.text: Twenty, maybe less, sir- Vidal does the math.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia lifts her brother from the cradle. OFELIA. We're leaving. Together. Don't be afraid. Nothing is going to happen to you. She wraps him in a blanket and tries to soothe him. Halfw to the door, she hears footsteps and hides in a nook.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Put the remaining men on picket duty at the tree line- when another squad gets back, have it report immediately to me. Vidal comes back in, followed by the Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Call for reinforcements.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. The Sergeant leaves, Vidal goes to his drink. But he sto to pick up his gold and silver watch; he winds it and sli it into his pocket. Finally, he drinks his Orujo. In the shadows, Ofelia takes a few steps towards the door Outside, the sound of SHOUTING and GUNFIRE. An explosion illuminates the room, revealing Ofelia and the baby to Vidal. Vidal takes out his gun and takes a few faltering steps.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Put him down- The girl edges toward the study door. Vidal stumbles towa her. Outside, a terrible explosion shatters the window an shakes the whole house.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: I'm warning you- put him down- He trips on his desk, barely staying on his feet. Ofelia runs away. Vidal tries to shake himself awake and goes af her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl runs toward the kitchen. Another explosion light up the room, allowing Vidal to see her. He heads straight her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia runs outside, holding her brother. She looks up. T moon is FULL. She runs toward the labyrinth.  Vidal staggers out behind her. In the background, more explosions, flames and bursts of fire. A battle rages in forest. Some bullets whiz past Vidal, but he keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes walks up the attic stairs, followed by Pedro and few of his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds the attic empty. On a wall there is a child's chalk drawing of a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia dashes into the labyrinth. Vidal is not far behind The sleeping medicine makes him stumble and falter. He slumps against a wall. Ofelia gains on him. But right away, she loses her way, but the leafy walls mo aside to guide her-! -first one, then another- -and yet another. Vidal, meanwhile, bumps into obstacles at every turn. Hea spinning, he pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the rotunda, Ofelia sees the Faun waiting, half up the stone staircase. Ofelia calms the baby and starts down the stairs toward h

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: Quickly, Your Majesty, give him to me. The full moon is almost here and we need him to open the portal. OFELIA. (seeing something) What's that in your hand? It's the golden dagger.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: The portal will only open if we shed the blood of an innocent. A pin prick- That's all. Just a drop of blood- It's the last task!! Hurry!! The basket shakes furiously. The Green Fairy escapes and buzzes furiously around Ofelia.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You promised to do it, so give me the boy. I want to leave this place, I can't wait any longer! The Faun comes closer to the girl. His face radiates a wicked hunger. She steps back, horrified. OFELIA. No. My brother stays with me.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You would give up your sacred rights for this brat? OFELIA. Yes, I would.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: You will give up your throne for him? He who has caused you such misery, such humiliation? Vidal comes into the rotunda. He sees Ofelia, alone. He can't see the Faun. With enormous effort, Vidal lifts his gun. OFELIA. I will.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: As you wish- Your Highness- As he recedes into the darkness, Vidal shoots. The bullet hits Ofelia in the stomach. She falls gently to the groun at the edge of the well, clutching her baby brother. The book lands next to her. Vidal picks up the infant. Ofelia reaches out for help, tears in her eyes. Vidal ignores her, spits on the ground and leaves. CAMERA closes in on Ofelia's face. A ribbon of blood stre from her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidal runs down the last path of the labyrinth, leading t the exit-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -where Pedro and his men are waiting. In their midst: Mercedes. With a loud bang- gunshots tear into Vidal. Vidal falls t his knees, hoisting his howling son in the air.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: My son-  Mercedes walks forward. Vidal and Mercedes look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Tell him about his father- About the time his father died- Mercedes takes the baby in her arms. Vidal understands the situation. He takes out his pocket watch and smashes it on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: VIDAL
dialogues.text: Tell him-

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: No- Pedro steps over to Vidal, gun in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (to Vidal) He wonвЂ™t even know your name. Mercedes! words are Vidal's last and most painful wound. face goes pale- - and Pedro shoots him in the head. Vidal collapses, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes and Pedro reach the rotunda. Mercedes kneels nex to the dying girl. Crying, Mercedes hums a sweet Galician lullaby. Ofelia's pupils dilate. Her blood runs down into the well, into the puddle at the bottom. The moon's reflection shimmers. In the book, an image takes shape: Ofelia at a royal cour  in front of a fabulous banquet.

dialogues.speaker: KING/FATHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Arise, my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ofelia stands. The labyrinth has disappeared. This is an immense hall, in a dark, sumptuous castle. A swarm of fairies floats around her head. Before her, on a golden throne sits the KING OF THE UNDERWORLD. At his side, an almost unrecognizable Carmen - radiant an gilded, she has transformed into a FAIRY QUEEN. Between them, there is another throne, empty, waiting. Ofelia looks at the King- OFELIA. (a whisper) Father...

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: It was your blood and not that of an innocent that made you worthy of the throne. It was the last task. The most important one... And out from behind a pillar comes out the Faun. Smiling, surrounded by the Fairies.

dialogues.speaker: FAUN
dialogues.text: And you chose well, Your Highness... He bows down.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: So, come sit by your FatherвЂ™s side, my child? HeвЂ™s been waiting so long. The Green Fairy flies around Ofelia, celebrating her retu Ofelia is cheered by a hundred voices.  Ofelia smiles-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and finally dies. In her eye: one frozen tear. Mercedes hugs the dead girl. CAMERA dollies back. The moon is reflected at the bottom the pool. Buzzing in the night air is the Stick Insect.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: And it is said that the Princess went back to her father's kingdom- And that she reigned with justice and a kind heart for many centuries. And that she was loved by all her subjects...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sunlight emanates gradually from the darkness and shi on the silhouette of the fallen fig tree.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: And, like most of us, she left behind small traces of her time on earth. Visible only to those that know where to look... The fig tree is flowering again. FADE TO BLACK.
